channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lots of litter all over the sidewalk on the entire street, 29th September
item.description:
The sidewalks are covered in litter: cans, dog poo, everything. Please pick up especially around the trees and on the sidewalks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mountgrove Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council activity concern, 29th September
item.description:
The residents in Enfield are shocked that over the past three years the property developer of 50-54 Church Hill N21, has illegally felled fifty ancient oak trees, with birds nesting each year, on conservation area land and despite us having reported this, no investigation or prosecution has been carried out by Enfield council. Concerningly the council have allowed a planning application for three luxury homes, unaffordable to most people in Enfield and unnecessarily proposed on woodland, already destroyed in full view of our council. This is after the illegal felling of the 1000 year old tree at whitewebbs Toby carvery. Ergin Erbil also claimed he would investigate this and has fallen silent. On Merrivake a similar,y aged tree was felled outside a house owned by someone working with the council during covid. We are concerned about conservations behind closed doors and shocked that a criminal is being allowed to push forward a planning application to fell more trees. The images convey before and after his destruction of wildlife homes. The trees were not ill or damaged and thrived for 100s of years . A criminal investigation is needed rather than a planning application..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Hill, Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chairs dumped in street, 29th September
item.description:
There were two chairs dumped at the end of the alleyway approximately one month ago. People are adding to them and the heap has grown, now one more chair and bags of clothes plus graffiti adding to the mess. I think the two original chairs were left for someone to take as they were quite reasonable, but the people never came back to dispose of them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38,40, Edgehill Road, London

item.title: Fly tipping in my bins, 29th September
item.description:
I sent photo of neighbour fly tipping in my bin,you sent someone out who took their bin not mine . So my bins are full of their rubbish . The grey and green bin are on the left side

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped waste now overflowing, 29th September
item.description:
Behind the back of Grovelands Road flats there is a shared bin with the words "falcon close" on it that has been taken away and filled with building waste and then topped up with household waste that has not been collected for several monthsm Previous reports state it is not the problem of the council. However its not only an environmental hazard, attacting flies and the dumping recently of birds, it's also now spewing out onto the road and causing a potential hazard to cars when parking and moving up and down the road. Please can this be removed as soon as possible. If not possible can reasons be stated why the council does not believe this is its responsibility given it's a council bin and on a road maintained by the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorchester Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branches falling from trees on street, 29th September
item.description:
Hello, there are some beautiful mature trees on the street in front of 41 Woolwich Road. However, we have had several incidents recently of large branches falling to the ground, meaning several near-misses for pedestrians on this busy stretch of pavement where people are often walking from the bus stop. Looking up I can see several large branches that are starting to sag and look like they could fall very soon. Could you please arrange for the trees to be pruned as soon as possible to avoid any dangerous incidents? Thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Woolwich Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped rubbish plus large waste items, 29th September
item.description:
Fly tipped rubbish strewn across road edges and spilling over pavement. School children forced to walk through piles of trash to get to buses. My child got a discarded cable caught around her feet this morning. Large broken items (bed bases?) also abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weyman Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet
